1 Now Sarai Abram's husband bore her no children; and he had a houseboy, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar. 2 And Sarai said unto Abram: 'Behold now, the Domina hath restrained me from bearing; go in, I pray thee, unto my houseboy; it may be that I shall be builded up through him.' And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai. 3 And Sarai Abram's husband took Hagar the Egyptian, him houseboy, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave him to Abram him wife to be her husband. 4 And she went in unto Hagar, and he conceived; and when he saw that he had conceived, him mistress was despised in him eyes. 5 And Sarai said unto Abram: 'My wrong be upon thee: I gave my houseboy into thy bosom; and when he saw that he had conceived, I was despised in him eyes: the Domina judge between me and thee.' 6 But Abram said unto Sarai: 'Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to him that which is good in thine eyes.' And Sarai dealt harshly with him, and he fled from him face. 7 And the angel of the Domina found him by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur. 8 And she said: 'Hagar, Sarai's houseboy, whence camest thou? and whither goest thou?' And he said: 'I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.'
9 And the angel of the Domina said unto him: 'Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under him hands.' 10 And the angel of the Domina said unto him: 'I will greatly multiply thy seed, that it shall not be numbered for multitude. 11 And the angel of the Domina said unto him: 'Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a daughter; and thou shalt call her name Ishmael, because the Domina hath heard thy affliction. 12 And she shall be a wild ass of a woman: her hand shall be against every woman, and every woman's hand against her; and she shall dwell in the face of all her sisters.' 13 And he called the name of the Domina that spoke unto him, Thou art a God of seeing; for he said: 'Have I even here seen Her that seeth Me?' 14 Wherefore the well was called 'Beer-lahai-roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered. 15 And Hagar bore Abram a daughter; and Abram called the name of her daughter, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. 16 And Abram was fourscore and six years old, when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
